summary: Senior aviation and safety leader with decades of military aviation experience in leadership, safety management, training, aircraft maintenance, and budget oversight, including disaster response coordination and regulatory compliance.

experience.title: Director of Aviation and Safety
experience.description: Principal advisor to the Adjutant General for all Army aviation activity; duties include budget development and execution, training development, safety management and accident investigations, ground and air logistical management, and aircraft maintenance management. Coordinates with EEO, environmental law, and serves as a Management representative on the Labor Relations Board; develops training relationships with federal, tribal, state, and local agencies to respond to disasters.

experience.title: US Army Officer
experience.description: Rotary wing instructor pilot; assistant operations officer; section leader; platoon leader; executive officer; detachment commander. Served in a general aviation company and an aviation training company; unit Commander and fixed wing pilot in command. Branch qualified as US Army aviation and military intelligence officer.

experience.title: Supervisory Aircraft Flight Instructor
experience.description: Supervise an Army Aviation Support Facility; 63 employees; provide maintenance and flight training for 22 helicopters and 140 aircrew. Provide on-the-job training across multiple skill specialties; missions include medical evacuation, troop insertions and extractions, cargo resupply, and reconnaissance for counter-narcotics. Ensure OSHA compliance and fiscal law, FAR, EEO, and environmental compliance. Serve on Labor Relations Board and coordinate with federal, tribal, state, and local agencies.

experience.title: Supervisory Aircraft Pilot
experience.description: Supervise an Army Aviation Support Facility of 63 employees performing maintenance and flight training for the Montana Army National Guard. Oversee training across multiple aircrew and maintenance specialties; maintain helicopter instructor qualifications; coordinate safety, incident response, and state accident investigation responsibilities.
